Welcome to REST HW’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
main.root()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.birthdays_per_weak(user: User, db: Session)¶
The birthdays_per_weak function returns a list of contacts that have their birthday in the next 7 days.
Args:

user (User): The user whose contacts are being queried. db (Session): A database session to query from.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with their birthday in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactModel): The contact to create. user (User): The current user, who is creating the contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact data to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id of the logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The get_contact function takes in a contact_id and user, and returns the contact with that id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. user (User): The User object associated with this request.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Find the contact in the database

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, db: Session)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.
Args:

user (User): The User object to get contacts from. db (Session): A database session to use when querying the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database. Args: contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. This is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to this user are deleted, and not contacts belonging to other users with similar IDs.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Identify the user that is logged in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contact(value: str, user: User, db: Session)¶
The search_contact function searches for a contact in the database.
Args:

value (str): The search term to look for. user (User): The user who is searching for the contact.

Parameters:

  • value – str: Search for a contact by firstname, lastname or email

  • user – User: Get the user id from the user object

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactModel): The updated contact information. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. user (User): The current logged-in user, used for authorization purposes.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact information that is being updated

  • contact_id – int: Identify which contact to update

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed_email field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Create a new user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of parameter that is expected

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • token – str | None: Specify that the token parameter can be either a string or none

  • db – Session: Connect to the database and update the user’s refresh token

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The birthdays function returns a list of users with birthdays in the current week.

The function is called by sending a GET request to /birthdays.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of users with their birthdays in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass in the contact information to be added

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact function returns a single contact from the database.

The function takes an integer as its only argument, which is the ID of the contact to be returned. If no such contact exists in the database, then a 404 error is raised.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be removed, and returns a User object with all of its contacts.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contact(value: str = Query(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contact function is used to search for a contact in the database.

The function takes in a string value and returns the user object if found.

Parameters:

  • value – str: Search for a contact in the database

  • description – Describe the parameter in the swagger documentation

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, which is then used to update the contact. If no user with that id exists, it returns 404 Not Found.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id from the token

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Pass the current user into the function

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a User object and Session object as parameters, which are both provided by Depends().

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is such a user, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not; if it has been confirmed already, we return an appropriate message; otherwise we update their account status in our database.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message saying that the email is confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, verifies them against what’s stored in the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A token, but what does the refresh function return?

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A new access_token and refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed account associated with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. If the email address already exists in the database, an HTTP 409 error is raised. The password field of the UserModel object is hashed using Argon2 and stored in that form. A new user record is created with this information and returned to the client.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user’s email and password from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object, but it also returns a detail string

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time for when the token expires

Returns:

A string, which is the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data passed in as a parameter

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that is being decoded

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be called by the FastAPI dependency injection system to get the current user. It will use the token in the Authorization header (that was added by OAuth2) to retrieve it from the database.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our secret key, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If so, it returns the email address stored in its sub field. If not, it raises an HTTPException indicating that the scope is invalid for this type of token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that we want to decode

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their account

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. The function takes in three parameters: -email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that they can click on within their browser.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address to send the message to

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the host of the application to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
